docs.snippet: We need to figure out how to avoid future tragedies.

Wondering why Facebook seems to be taking baby steps to address the biggest scandal in its history? Stronger safeguards on user data might damage Facebook's core business of using what it knows about you to sell ads that target your interests.

headline.print_headline: Behind Facebook's Baby Step Fixes: Defending Its Ad Business
headline.main: Behind Facebook's Baby Step Fixes: Defending Its Ad Business

docs.snippet: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg plans to testify before Congress about the company's privacy practices in coming weeks, according to a person familiar with the matter.

headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg Plans to Testify Before Congress
headline.main: Zuckerberg Plans to Testify Before Congress

docs.snippet: The leaders of a key House committee declared Thursday that Facebook officials failed to answers questions about a privacy scandal involving a Trump-connected data-mining company, and they want CEO Mark Zuckerberg to testify before the panel.

headline.print_headline: House Committee Calls for Facebook's Zuckerberg to Testify
headline.main: House Committee Calls for Facebook's Zuckerberg to Testify

docs.snippet: Facebook is facing the most serious crisis in its 14-year history as it deals with fallout from a major leak of user data to political consultants associated with the 2016 Trump campaign.

headline.print_headline: AP News Guide: Facebook's Widening Crisis Over User Data
headline.main: AP News Guide: Facebook's Widening Crisis Over User Data

docs.snippet: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to answer questions from British lawmakers about a scandal over the firm's data is "astonishing", the parliamentary committee chief who invited him to attend said on Tuesday.
